name: Radisson Hotel Madison

reviews.text: I have got to know quite a few hotels in the Madison area and this one is not that great. For a 3 star hotel, I have some serious reservations compared to other area hotel options. Overall, if you want a 3 star hotel, there are much better options in the Madison area.
reviews.title: In need of some serious updating - better alternatives in Madison

reviews.text: First, let's start with some positives. I thought the staff were very pleasant and I even got to meet the manager upon checkin. He seemed nice and I am sure will respond appropriately given the fact that he regularly comments on user reviers. The bed is the kind where you can adjust the comfort level which is very nice. Also, the bedding was very nice and comfortable. Plus, they offer a free continental breakfast with basic options and also have free wireless internet access.
reviews.title: Nice room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now for the bad. The place is seriously rundown. When you first arrive, you will be shocked that this is even a 3 star in the first place. The parking lot is old and cracked. The building looks like it has never been updated. The landscaping is full of weeds and not kept up. Inside, the hallways have carpet that has bumps in it and could cause a tripping hazard. The rooms are need updating. The air conditioner is something one would expect in a Motel 6. Manual controls and placed directly next to the desk. Thus, if you are working at the desk, the air will blow directly on you. The couch looks like something my grandmother purchased in the '70s. The bathroom is significantly small and the exhaust vent made more noise than a semi truck. Worse, the fire door between the adjoining rooms provided a nice way to hear just about everything that happens in the room next door. So, if you like hearing your neighbors, this is the place to be.
reviews.title: Nice surprise

reviews.text: Bottomline - this is an old hotel that needs a serious update to be considered in the same class as a Courtyard or Garden Inn. The fact that is considered a 3 star is quite alarming. I would say this hotel is a 2 maybe 2.5, but not in the same category as a other 3 star hotels.
reviews.title: Clean, Quiet, Friendly, Full Breakfast AND Affordable. There is a Santa Claus

reviews.text: Picked this hotel solely on location due to a trip with very tight time restraints. Had this been a longer term stay, there were a few highly rated hotels and B&B's that would have been in play.
reviews.title: trip

reviews.text: I liked this Radisson. It was clean, comfortable, and quiet. What else do you need in a hotel?
reviews.title: Pretty Good
Shoddy and Confusing Reservation Service
reviews.text: I live in Madison and made reservations for visiting family members who were attending a funeral and would pay for their rooms themselves. I reserved 6 rooms on my credit card and later called to cancel one room (received by email the confirmed cancellation notification). The staff manged to make this process extremely unwieldy and confusing. Further, they charged my card for one phantom room because they claimed the party never showed. It seems that when the family arrived, they were told that no room for them had been reserved, and were given a different room. I was then charged for the room I originally reserved for them, which remained empty. Staff were rude and unhelpful when I tried to explain the situation.

This outdated hotel room was the worst I have seen in many years. I travel for business and have seen a lot of hotel rooms and from the time I walked into this one I knew it was a bad one. The rooms had an unpleasant odor. The bathroom with tub and toilet was barley big enough to move around in or get into the shower, just enough room for a towel to place on floor....that’s it. The bed was hard as a rock and could not sleep much. Wireless did not work but the desk did have an Ethernet cable to plug into however not enough receptacles and poor chair for working. To top it off the window faced an auto lot and when opening the curtain in the morning was greeted by employees from the auto lot and the carpet seemed very old. I was limited in room choices on this trip because of a convention and the room cost more than most of the nice new hotels rooms in the area.
reviews.title: Worst experience

reviews.text: I stayed at the Radisson Hotel because the place I usually stay, the Fairfield Inn - Middleton, was full. I have stayed at the Radisson Inn Green Bay Airport and love that hotel, and was hoping for a similar experience. Not so.
reviews.title: Hotel is run down. Find somewhere else to stay if you can.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tub drain was clogged and so I couldn't take a shower the first morning there. The wireless high speed internet didn't work (throughout the hotel -- I heard other people in the hall talking about it). The toilet in my room had rust and mold stains. The room doors are weighted and you could always hear other people's door slamming shut as they were coming or going, and this woke me up late at night and early in the morning. The plumbing was loud and you could hear your neighbor when they flushed the toilet, ran water, or took a shower. The room decor was dark and sort of creepy. I just felt like the place wasn't clean.
reviews.title: Had a great stay.

reviews.text: This hotel was a big disappointment. I stayed here for 2 nights and moved to a different hotel for the third night. This hotel (and my room in particular) is directly on the highway, so there is a fair amount of road noise for some rooms. It seemed to me like the staff just wasn't interested in maintaining the hotel properly. I had several burnt-out bulbs in my room, the floor had holes underneath the carpet (I could feel them with my feet), the alarm clock and bedside lamp weren't plugged in (perhaps to plug in the Sleep Number bed), and the TV cabinet was missing some hardware. My toilet didn't work properly. There were a lot of small details that really showed the sub-par maintenance of the place. Free internet was nice and the hot breakfast was decent. I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Not up to Radisson's normal standards

reviews.text: I have stayed here on business many times over the past few years. The MAD-RAD is close to so many things -- restaurants, shopping, and the Beltline. While it is not the most upscale hotel, it is reasonably priced, offers various services, and is quite comfortable for me.
reviews.title: I've stayed here many times...almost my home away from home.

reviews.text: I've stayed at this Radisson several times over the last year and I've always been extremely impressed by the service and staff upon check-in/check-out. There are great touches included at this hotel like the SleepNumber bed (have fun trying to figure out your number!) and a hot breakfast. The only things that I've had issues with before were the noise from the hallways comes through very easily. Additionally, the rooms are starting to show a little age... My guess would be that this hotel is ready for a remodel soon.
reviews.title: Very nice Radisson; But showing it's age

reviews.text: All in all, a good stay!
reviews.title: A great stay with great staff

reviews.text: Tiu made my stay veery comfortable. It was great to experiance Madison with a hotel like this
reviews.title: 1st time in a hotel in years

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This medium-sized Radisson is located close to a large mall, in an area with many restaurants and small shops. It is not far from downtown Madison, and close to Camp Randall, which was very convenient for the football fans also staying at the hotel. The staff was fabulous - friendly and very attentive to our needs.
reviews.title: Convenient home-base for a busy weekend in Madison

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice, yet busy hotel. I would recommend it for family and business trips. Definitely not for a quiet get away, though, and rather pricey.
reviews.title: If you're looking for City Centre access don't come here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I booked for the Radisson in Madison I was under the mistaken impression - completely my fault for not consulting a map - that it would be city centre located - WRONG! We spent ages driving around the Capitol trying to locate it only to find it was off the freeway about 10 miles away. Not a bad hotel and fortunately there were a few decent restaurants - Longhorn Steakhouse and Jim Delaney's - in spitting distance fortunate as the one in the Rad was a bit lacking in atmosphere. Best thing about the hotel was the bed which you can now adjust to your sleep position and which had loads of fluffy pillows. No view, of course...
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: We had a nice 3 night stay at the Radisson Hotel Madison. After running intoa booking snafu with Priceline, Shannon jumped into action to make sure we had a room despite the fact that the hotel was pretty much booked up. Somehow I planned our trip the weekend of the Ironman Competition and a Badgers Game. Our reservation was made for one night instead of 3. I went on line and couldn't find a room anywhere in Madison and went back to Shannon. Somehow she found us a room at the Radisson and continued to be super helpful throughout our stay. Kudos also to Megan and the hospitable bartender Paul at Basie's. Thanks for the great customer service! I also liked the very comfortable beds with all white linens and lots of soft pillows.
reviews.title: Comfort, quiet and convienence

reviews.text: The Radisson Hotel offered my family and I a very plesant stay. The comfort of the sleep number bed, the quiet atmosphere and the location of the property made this experience with Radisson worth the time. I would definitely return to this hotel for future lodging needs. Thank You.
reviews.title: Friendliness and service of staff was outstanding

description: The Radisson Hotel Madison is under new management. We are also excited to announce that our hotel has recently finished a top to bottom hotel-wide renovation to enhance the overall guest experience. Relax in our new lobby, enjoy the new guestrooms with 37" flatscreens, refridgerators, free platinum level wi-fi, & complimentary brekafast buffet. Get here worry free in our complimentary airport shuttle 7am-11pm, dine at Basie's Restaurant & Lounge or order room service. The Radisson is a smoke-free, Green Hotel, that also boasts an indoor pool, fitness room and 24-hour full-service Business Center.PLEASE NOTE: OUR POOL AREA WILL BE CLOSED APRIL 21-MAY 1 AS WE COMPLETE RENOVATIONS IN THAT AREA.
